intro: Prionanthium dentatum, commonly known as the toothed kokia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It is notable for its unique morphology, including its toothed leaves and compact growth habit. Due to habitat loss, Prionanthium dentatum is considered endangered, highlighting the need for conservation efforts.
